column4: I'm having problem with long filenames during usb-fat install. For example firewir*.udeb is called firewir*.udeb which really causes some problems, what could I do?
? I thought I was using fat16
if its truncating names, then its not.
ok, how could I reformat it in windows then?
start > run > mmc > File > Add/Remove (or Insert, I forgot) > Disk Management
theres only fat and fat32 . I'm using fat but it still gives tuncarted filenames
includes support for extended file names
I also tried fat32 but for some reason unetbootin or wtf still gives me wrong filenames
I have no idea what is unetbootin
then I suggest you ask the developer there, as its not an issue with Ubuntu.
well, basically that's just an app I found from ubuntu's "iki"
